subject: Medicine
title: The Tuskegee Experiment
description: A 60-second lesson on The Tuskegee Experiment.

hook.text: For 40 years, the US government let Black men die of syphilisâ€”without telling them or offering treatment.

buildup.text: The Tuskegee Study ran from 1932 to 1972, studying untreated syphilis in 399 African American men.

discovery.text: Participants were told they were getting free treatment. Instead, they received placebos while the disease progressed.

twist.text: Even after penicillin became available in the 1940s, researchers withheld it to continue observing the disease.

climax.text: The scandal led to the Belmont Report and modern research ethics rules requiring informed consent.

punchline.text: The worst betrayal in medicine created its strongest rules.

quiz.question: What major change resulted from the Tuskegee scandal?
options: The Belmont Report and mandatory informed consent in research
A complete ban on all medical research
The creation of the first medical school in the US
